text: Everything hurts. Your stomach feels like it’s being hollowed out by a gremlin with a scalpel and abandonment issues.

choices.text: Try to crawl to the bathroom

text: The EMTs arrive and immediately start asking if you're pregnant. You’re not.
They fail to get an IV, then jab you with fentanyl so hard it hits bone. You scream.
You start to question all your life choices that led to this moment.
You make it halfway to the toilet before collapsing. Your cat stares at you like you're ruining its vibe.
You vomit bile, miss the bucket, and pass out on the floor. You wake up an hour later in a pool of regret and cat hair.
You arrive at the ER and are told to take a number. It's 137. The screen reads 22.
A child with a broken arm gets in before you. A man with a nosebleed is called next. You begin to question the space-time continuum.

choices.text: Wait quietly and crochet a rage blanket
